comment: Took her as a 4 week class and sure, its a good amount of work to do but if you give her good work youll do well. No tests just quizzes that are webcam BUT theyre super easy and most are common sense. Overall shes a great professor and I recommend
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: What she makes you write about doesnt make sense. Let us write about any sport documentary and said we didnt need approval. Said my content wasnt directly related to what we learned in class? Everything else was apparently perfect but that gave me a 70? Dont take an online class. Doesnt communicate. Online course page is cluttered. Not helpful

I took this class online and I thought the quizzes were impossible. The lecture videos were so monotone and I couldn't pay attention. This professor is great and very organized but I don't think she realizes how specific her quiz questions were and how we can't be expected to memorize details from reading the book. Quizzes were lockdown w camera.

She's very helpful! I took this class online. She did an excellent job providing the material in a very efficient and organized manner. Quizzes are easy, as long as you study the material. An easy grader and fair!! Would definitely take her again.

Professor Butler is a very sweet professor. Her lectures can be quite boring because she reads directly from the powerpoint. WORD FOR WORD. But, aside from that, there was a group project and volunteer hours. She is a very nice woman. I would recommend.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Butler handled classes moving online due to COVID-19 better than I could have imagined. She was forced to change this entire class's curriculum due to the Final Four being canceled, and she handled it so well.

Dr. Butler was not the best candidate to teach into our Intro to SM class, the class itself was not Intro to SM, it was more of Intro to Diversity in Sport, which became very annoying to listen to after the second week. She does require a minimum of 10 volunteer hours which I planned on using for the Final Four (Before COVID). Tests were easy.
